runs.comm: makes him reach out with a length ball outside off, bunted into the covers
examines the inside edge quite studiously as he mistimes a slash through the off side
short again and Porterfield slaps it backward of point. But a good dive from the fielder stops the runs
much slower in pace, much fuller in length. Sucks Porterfield into a drive on the up. Edged, but no slip
tossed up just outside off, driven down to long-off
that was on the cards. First ball Stirling faces has been muscled for six. Flat and tight on middle. But he gets down low and lap sweeps it into the crowd
back of a length on middle and leg, nudged around the corner to short fine leg
lets the shortish ball come on outside off and runs it down to short third man
sharp seam movement into the batsman, courtesy the fast bowler pitching it up. The line is excellent as well, on fourth stump. Sitrling plays an uncertain defensive, gets an inside edge
back of a length on off stump, defended
catches him offguard with respect to pace. Its short and cutting in at the body, Stirling was going for a flick and cant connect

plays inside the line! End of a top over from van der Gugten. If the batsmen didnt have any worries on the pitch, some might be creeping in now. A shortish delivery holds its line just outside off and beats Stirlings tentative push.

top edge! Appalling shot from the Ireland captain. Premeditated a lap sweep, but the ball was a shade too short for it and moving across the left-handed Porterfield. The ball leaps straight up and cover runs in to collect a simple catch
good length on off stump, tapped in front of point for a quick single
stays back in his crease and works the shortish delivery off his hips behind square leg

dreadful from Netherlands this time. Short fine leg simply lets the ball through him. Swart was the man diving to his left, but doesnt get down in time. Pretty delivery from Bukhari too, getting the ball to jerk in at the batsman. Stirling, to his credit, plays with the movement and pulls out a leg glance
full and angled in at the pads, whipped to short leg and Swart manages to rein this in

deftly done! Picked the gap between backward point and short third man. Looks like hes picking the bowler perfectly. This one was going away from the bat, Stirling watched it carefully, used an open face and slices the ball through
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
jumps down the track to try and smash the ball through the off side. But van der Gugten delliveres a 140 kph shortish delivery outside off and beats him.
bit appeal from the keeper, but it clipped the thigh pad. Moves forward and across on off stump to try and glance the back of a length ball off his hips.
waits on the shortish delivery and knocks it down to the right of mid-on. Pleasing cricket. Clever strokeplay from batsmen, intent from the quicks
leans into a little push down the ground. Preferred to trust his timing there did Balbirnie and finds a single between mid-on and mid-off
takes a length ball from middle and off and whips it away to long leg
pulls him forward with a good length ball on off stump, Balbirnie defends to cover
seams away from the outside edge! Probing bowling from Netherlands, and this time Bukhari hits an uncertain length just outside off. Balbirnie inches forward and pokes with his hands. Cant connect
pushed into the covers, and finds teh gapo

lobs it to mid-on! The bat face turned in his hand, so he had no timing on the shot. Bukhari roars again. It was a fuller delivery on off stump, so Stirling may have misread it as an opportunity to go big. Couldnt execute it
oooh, that was a touch risky too. Bukhari makes the ball swing in this time and the new batsman walks across and outside his crease and flicks it past short fine leg

oh, gorgeous! Wilson is not messing around here. Takes a couple of steps down the track to meet the length ball and caresses it through extra cover. Mid-off attempts a dive, of course, but he cant stop it
gets extra bounce! Hits a pleasing line on and around off stump and with his height, he surprises the batsman who was trying to flick. Missed
bounces over the square cut! It was short, it was wide, it was there for the shot. But van Meekrens bounce is too much
that time he makes the bounce work for him. Lovely riposte from Balbirnie as he steps forward to a length ball and flicks it over the infield to the midwicket boundary. Top shot
back of a length ball and outside off, leaps up to hit the splice of the bat as he defends
shortish and outside off, run down to point
pins him on the back foot, Balbirnie defends on middle and off stump
good length just outside off, Wilson is forward to block
worked the shortish ball off his pads to midwicket
good job from the captain at short cover! This was pristinely timed from Wilson. Pretty high elbow visible as he leans forward and displays the cover drive
sizes up the shorter ball coming in at his body and nudges it off his hips to long leg
skews off the outside half of the bat, but he was looking to pierece that gap through point. Square drive fetches two
neatly done by the two batsmen. Balbirnie knocked it in front of cover and put the fielders under pressure by setting off straight away. Misfield happens to allow an eventually easy single
and hes in the game straight away. Teasing flight, slow through the air as well. Pitches into the dry pitch, grips and turns to take the outside edge and sneak past slip
makes him play against the turn with the drift he is getting. But this time he has pitched close enough to the batsman to do that without any problems. Driven to long-on
nips down the track and picks a floated delivery off his toes to deep midwicket
shortish on middle and leg, tucked through midwicket
loopy delivery on off stump, the batsman leaves his crease and ends up yorking himself. Drummed straight to point
pulls the length back just an inch, on off stump, so the drive Wilson was looking for ends up a thickish outside edge to point
the captain starts off with too much width and Balbirnie has sliced him through point. Excellent stroke

Oooh, a ricochet  from the bowler onto the stumps! This is going to be close! Good length ball pushed back down the pitch. Borren gets down to it, manages to put a good finger on the ball to deflect it onto the stumps. But Wilson has first held the bat in his left hand, and then pulled off a desperate dive to save himself
beautifully done. Takes a length ball that was heading for the middle of off stump and guides it to the third man boundary. All he wanted to do was pick the gap and place it behind point
fuller delivery outside off, driven to point
moves leg side of a very full ball on leg stump and thumps to through to the sweeper

lifted over extra! But Long-off has done extremely well. Peter Seelar saves his side a run. He seems to know where the gaps are, does Balbirnie. Gets forward to an easy paced length ball and lobs it over the infield
lunges forward to a flighted delivery outside off and sweeps powerfully to deep square leg
nips down the track and sends the good length ball outside off to long-off

Wilson was looking for a single, theres none there! Another big dive helps keep his wicket. Tossed up delivery just outside off. The batsman was sucked into a drive on the up and loses his shape. So the ball goes in the air towards point. Not a chance for a catch, but an overeager Wilson almost offered a different opportunity
flighted delivery outside off, pushed through the covers
spotted the batsman coming down and shortens his length, clipped away through midwicket. Wilson wants two, but Balbirnie says no considering the deep fielders good work
pushed through and comes on with the arm, sliced to short third man
goes short, the batsman wanted to hit it too hard. So predictably he mistimes it to midwicket
fired in on middle and leg, Balbirnie jumps outside leg and punches through the covers
races down, turns a flighted delivery on leg stump into a full toss. All that was left was the big heave. Out it comes, but it becomes an outside edge to short third man
length ball pushed into the pads as he sees the batsman making room. Driven to long-on
short ball, worried about the batsman running down the track perhaps, Wilson pulls to long-on

fired down the leg side, Balbirnie looks to pull it fine. Was there an inside edge to that? Bowler thinks so. Keeper thought so too. And it wasnt called a wide either. The keeper moved well enough to his left to give himself the best change, but the ball pops out
short ball, pulled. Its in the air though. This tall, fast bowler gets disconcerting extra bounce. Top edge falls short of the incoming deep square leg and long leg fielders
beats him with pace and bounce again! Balbirnie goes for a pull, but he is playing well under the ball

straight up, and right into the keepers gloves! He was always a threat to the batsman, hustling them. This time Balbirnie looks to make the play by running down the track. He had made room as well to try and slice the ball over the off side. Looks to do that, but ends up skewing the ball to Barresi
back of a length on off stump, defended
short and just outside off, Wilson backs away and tonks the ball to point. KOB thought there was a single there, ran down so far that he gave up getting back. No direct hit
full and angled in on leg stump, Wilson looks to lift it over the off side having made room for himself. No luck

just falls short of short cover! Actually, that might have been a chance! Gorgeous flight from van der Merwe pulls the batsman into a drive on the up. Myburgh dives to his right, but he only goes with one hand
good length ball on middle, defended
jumps beside the shortish delivery on middle and cracks it through cover
goes short again to KOB, who is quite happy to tap it through the covers

rips the ball clean past the outside edge, but the keeper is looking for a stumping here. Dont think it was that close. Once he flights the ball, it can grip. It also means the batsman is pulled forward and has a greater chance of a mistake. This time there is none, with KOBs back foot firmly planted behind the crease
down the track he comes and hammers a length ball out of sight. Huge six right over the sightscreen
stays back and pulls a short ball to deep midwicket
moves across on off stump and tucks it through midwicket

hands on heads time for Netherlands. This is an 86mph short ball that lands safely despite Borren racing in from mid-on, I think it was. Bounce again worrying the batsman as he was looking to slap down the ground
short and outside off, Wilson pulls to deep midwicket
point throws himself to his left, but the slash has been placed a bit too far from him. Spectacular effort from Myburgh as he reaches out with his left hand.
back of a length on middle and leg, goes for a flick but wears it on the body
skips down the pitch, van der Merwe bowls it flat. Wilson adjusts and slices it to short third man
meanders down the track and lifts a flighted delivery to long-on
premeditated sweep again. Wilson moves outside off to try and pull it off, but van der Merwe bowls it too full and keeps it well outside off to foil the effort
good length ball outside off, driven through the covers
right through him! Saw Wilson running down the track, pulled his length back and its pretty much a straight ball. The batsman goes for a hasty flick, plays around it and has his stumps knocked back
good length ball on middle, clipped to midwicket
fires it into the pads, O Brien is down the track with a push to long-on
short and outside off, Mooney hammers it through to deep cover
catch it is the cry as KOB advances on the spinner and goes all gung ho. But the slog manifests as a thick outside edge that falls short of deep cover
clipped away through midwicket. The batsmen were looking for a couple, but KOB slips and says no
bye-bye baby! Gets under a length ball and pummels it way over midwicket. Lands well beyond the boundary and into a tree over there.
shoved away over fine leg! Roars from the crowd, and a catch drop as well. Seelar goes full, fast and down leg side. KOB lends it some air miles
slower short ball down leg, pulled to long leg
goes wide of the crease for a short ball outside off, clubbed to deep midwicket
thats fast and short. Mooney is a little cramped as he goes for a one-legged pull. Single to long leg
low full toss, curling in at him. Clipped to deep midwicket
length ball, in the slot, Mooney swings and misses. The bye is the only saving grace for Netherlands
taken at long leg! KOB was looking for the pick up shot over leg again. Think he has hit it a bit too high on the bat. So the ball goes up a little too much and not long enough

oooh, thats catching practice to short third man. Wonder what he wanted to do with that. It was a slower, shortish delivery outside off. He just jumps up on the spot and plants an open face down on it. The lack of pace on the ball means it ends up as a dolly of a catch

shortish and outside off, the batsman slices the ball quite fine. But O Dowd races across to his left from deep third man and saves a boundary. Was pretty close to the ropes when he dived, but he is alright. Top work
banged in short and outside off, the batsman tries to ramp the ball but he cant reach it
full and speared into the blockhole, worked away to long leg. Oooh, an inswinging yorker too
slower short ball, but Thompson is able to adjust to it. Just cant find the gap behind point
goes around the wicket, floats a slower ball just outside off, Thompson goes for a big swing and misses

straight to deep square leg! The short ball has been working all day, even in the previous game. This time the batsman goes for a pull, and is into the shot a bit too early. Well bowled by Bukhari, deceived him with the lack of pace
what an absolute beaut! Pitched up outside off and Thompson strides forward and drills it over the top of mid-off. A-ma-zing timing
theres the short one, slanted down leg because the batsman was making room. Thompson tries the ramp, cant put  bat to ball

caught right on the edge of the midwicket boundary. Thomposon had nailed this as well, looked pretty imperious as he went into the flick. O Dowd though wasn;t thinking about any of those things. He was just watching the ball, backtracked as far as he could and took the catch very matter-of-factly
backs away to try and open up the off side, but Bukhari fires in a fuller ball and follows the batsman. Cant do much more than tap it back at the bowler
back of a length on middle and off, its slower as well. Dockrell tries to force the pace, but hits it only as far as cover

dropped by van der Merwe in the deep midwicket boundary. And it pops over the boundary too. Powerful hit from Dockrell as he gets behind a short ball and mauls it away. But the fielder has misjudged this. Thought he was too close to the rope and had to leap high and had to pull the ball down from behind him too. But actually he was well inside the rope
backs away to try and swipe a short delivery down the ground. Does well enough for a single
spears in a full yorker, curling in on leg stump. He somehow squeezes it out to point
pulled, awfully, to mid-ons hands. Its the slower short ball and Dockrell is into the shot too early

and thats how it ends. A misunderstanding and a run out. Its another short ball that zips past the cut shot and into the keepers gloves. The non-striker sets off straight away, but Young has not heard the call. By the time he decides to move, Barresi has thrown the ball to his bowler. Cusack was halfway down, turns around and watches himself getting run out
